You just did a 1 year dig

Havi4ban

item.title: [pi] different experience modes easy,medium,hard and extreme
item.dc:creator: @insinity insinity
item.description:
@insinity wrote:

to fix the xp changes when log out and you dont get xp simply do this case 9178:
if (c.dialogueAction == 23) {
Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 5000;
Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE = 5000;
Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 5000;
Player.easyMode = true;
Player.finishedTut = true;
PlayerSave.saveGame©;
c.getPA().removeAllWindows();
}

add PlayerSave.saveGame©;
in every game mode in clicking buttons and it will work

i havent found a fix for the walking.java so i deleted it! you don’t really need it

Read full topic
item.source: [pi] different experience modes easy,medium,hard and extreme

item.title: [pi] different experience modes easy,medium,hard and extreme
item.dc:creator: @trolheimer trolheimer
item.description:
@trolheimer wrote:

[quote=“voetbal645, post:1, topic:442620”][size=14pt]Different modes[/size]

Well what are we exactly adding is Different exp modes.

  • Easy 5K xp rate
  • medium 500xp rate hit higher then easy
  • Hard 50 xp rate, hit higher then easy and medium + infinity prayer
  • Extreme 10 xp rate, hit higher then easy,medium,hard + infinity prayer

Now let’s start.
First we are going to add that the mode will save if u click it.
We going to add the save method in playersave.java
First search for

And add this under

} else if (token.equals("easyMode")) { p.easyMode = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2); } else if (token.equals("mediumMode")) { p.mediumMode = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2); } else if (token.equals("hardMode")) { p.hardMode = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2); } else if (token.equals("extremeMode")) { p.extremeMode = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2); } else if (token.equals("finishTut")) { p.finishedTut = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2);
Now search for

under the newline add this.

characterfile.write("easyMode = ", 0, 11); characterfile.write(Boolean.toString(p.easyMode), 0, Boolean.toString(p.easyMode).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("mediumMode = ", 0, 13); characterfile.write(Boolean.toString(p.mediumMode), 0, Boolean.toString(p.mediumMode).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("hardMode = ", 0, 11); characterfile.write(Boolean.toString(p.hardMode), 0, Boolean.toString(p.hardMode).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("extremeMode = ", 0, 14); characterfile.write(Boolean.toString(p.extremeMode), 0, Boolean.toString(p.extremeMode).length()); characterfile.newLine(); characterfile.write("finishTut = ", 0, 12); characterfile.write(Boolean.toString(p.finishedTut), 0, Boolean.toString(p.finishedTut).length()); characterfile.newLine();
The Finishedtut will make the player can’t walk when selecting you will see it later this code.
This code will make 4 lines in you’re character map like
Easymode = false
mediumMode = false
HardMode = false
ExtremeMode = False
When you select a code when u login the false of the mode that u chosed gonna be = true
Save and close.
Now we gonna decleare the Finnishtut and the modes in player.java
If u don’t do this u will get errors.
This part is needed so it can read the codes.
Go to player.java and add these

public boolean finishedTut; public boolean easyMode, mediumMode, hardMode, extremeMode;
save and close.
Now we are going to add that hard mode and extreme mode doesn’t lose prayer only by smithing or soulsplit

ok search in client.java for this.
This will make it so dialogue 850 ( the dialogue with the options) shows up you can’t walk
And the declaring os easymode || MediumMode above prayerdrain
Will be that easymode and mediumode prayer goes down like normal and hard and extreme would get infinity prayer.
search for

getPA().handleWeaponStyle();
above it add

if (!finishedTut) { getDH().sendDialogues(850, -1); }

and under that add this
if (easyMode || mediumMode)
So it would look like this

getFishing().FishingProcess(); if (easyMode || mediumMode) getCombat().handlePrayerDrain();
Save and close
Now we are adding the dialogue on login so where u can chose you’re options
go to dialoguehandler.java and add this

case 850: sendOption4("Easy Mode 5000 xp rate", "Medium Mode 500 xp rate", "Hard Mode 50 xp rate", "Extreme Mode 10 xp rate"); c.dialogueAction = 850; break;
save and close
Now we gonna add so you can click on the rates and it will save.
go to clickingbuttons.java and search for
c.finishedTut = true;
This means that when u click the option it will change in you character map to true so you able to walk.

add this under it

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastButton > 600) { c.easyMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); c.lastButton = System.currentTimeMillis(); } }
then search for

add this under it

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastButton > 600) { c.mediumMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); c.lastButton = System.currentTimeMillis(); } }
then search for

add this under it

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastButton > 600) { c.hardMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); c.lastButton = System.currentTimeMillis(); } }
Then search for

under it add this

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { if (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.lastButton > 600) { c.extremeMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); c.lastButton = System.currentTimeMillis(); } }
save and close
i explain the code.
(c.dialogueAction == 850) {
This means what dialogue will come up so it’s 850.
now we gonna add the different experience rate.
Go to combatassistant.java and add this above

private int combatExp() { int amount = 0; if (c.easyMode) { amount = 5000; } else if (c.mediumMode) { amount = 500; } else if (c.hardMode) { amount = 50; } else if (c.extremeMode) { amount = 10; } return amount; }
The amount is the experience that u will get each hit.
you can change it if you want.

Now we gonna add that each mode hit a little bit better.

Search in combatassistant.java for

if(c.prayerActive[25]) { strength += (int)(lvlForXP * .23); }
add under that add this

if (c.easyMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .03); } else if (c.mediumMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .06); } else if (c.hardMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .09); } else if (c.extremeMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .12); }
lvlforxp means how much higher you will hit by the mode that you have selected easy to change.
save and close
Now for the last part go to walking.java
This will make so you can’t walk when you select the mode.
Add this in walking.java

if (!c.finishedTut) { c.sendMessage("You must first select a difficulty mode."); return; }

credits:
100% me for adding[/quote]

It doesn’t work the diff xp rate
everything works except the xp ammount.
I did exactly what you said but it doesn"t do it, what should i do now?

Read full topic

item.title: [pi] different experience modes easy,medium,hard and extreme
item.dc:creator: @EvilscapeV3 EvilscapeV3
item.description:
@EvilscapeV3 wrote:

I take no credit at all for any of this, even thought I did patch up the problem with exp. I just wanted all of you to see how easy it was to fix, and how crapply I did it

playersave.java
Under this:

Add:

} else if (token.equals("finishTut")) { p.finishedTut = Boolean.parseBoolean(token2);

Now find:

add this in this area:

            characterfile.write("finishTut = ", 0, 12);
            characterfile.write(Boolean.toString(p.finishedTut), 0, Boolean.toString(p.finishedTut).length());
            characterfile.newLine();[/code]

player.java

Above this

[code]public boolean
	initialized = false,[/code]

add this

[code]
public static boolean	
	easyMode = false,
	mediumMode = false,
	hardMode = false,
	extremeMode = false,
	finishedTut = false;
[/code]


client.java

Find:
[code]                        getPA().handleWeaponStyle();

Add this above it:

if (!finishedTut) { getDH().sendDialogues(850, -1); }

Find this

Add under:

dialoguehandler.java

Add this

case 850: sendOption4("Easy Mode 5000 xp rate", "Medium Mode 500 xp rate", "Hard Mode 50 xp rate", "Extreme Mode 10 xp rate"); c.dialogueAction = 850; break;

In Config.java change this

public static final int MELEE_EXP_RATE = 1400; // damage * exp rate
	public static final int RANGE_EXP_RATE = 1600;
	public static final int MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 1600;

to this

public static int MELEE_EXP_RATE;
	public static int RANGE_EXP_RATE;
	public static int MAGIC_EXP_RATE;

clickingbuttons.java

Find these:

Add under:

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 5000; Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE = 5000; Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 5000; c.easyMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); }

Find:

Add Under:

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 500; Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE = 500; Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 500; c.mediumMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); }

Find:

Add Under:

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 50; Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE = 50; Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 50; c.hardMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); }

Find:

Under add:

if (c.dialogueAction == 850) { Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE = 10; Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE = 10; Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE = 10; c.extremeMode = true; c.finishedTut = true; c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); }

combatassistant.java

Find Somthing Like this

Add this Above:

public static int meleeExp() {
        if (Player.easyMode) {
		} else if (Player.mediumMode) {
		} else if (Player.hardMode) {
		} else if (Player.extremeMode) {
		}
		return Config.MELEE_EXP_RATE; 
		}
	public static int rangeExp() {
        if (Player.easyMode) {
		} else if (Player.mediumMode) {
		} else if (Player.hardMode) {
		} else if (Player.extremeMode) {
		}
		return Config.RANGE_EXP_RATE;
		}
	public static int magicExp() {
        if (Player.easyMode) {
		} else if (Player.mediumMode) {
		} else if (Player.hardMode) {
		} else if (Player.extremeMode) {
		}
		return Config.MAGIC_EXP_RATE;
		}

The other combatassistant.java

Find:

if(c.prayerActive[25]) { strength += (int)(lvlForXP * .23); }
Add Under:

if (c.easyMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .03); } else if (c.mediumMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .06); } else if (c.hardMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .09); } else if (c.extremeMode) { strength += (int) (lvlForXP * .12); }

^ this will get a slight max hit boost for the differnt modes

walking.java

Add:

if (!c.finishedTut) { c.sendMessage("You must first select a difficulty mode."); return; }

Than in Client.java find this

under PlayerSave.saveGame(this);

add Player.finishedTut = false;

Remove the save for exp modes, I see no point in saving if your going allow players to change it. Also added that on logout your finishedtut resets to false, so on login you can select new exp rate if you wish.

Read full topic
